Package ohos.miscservices.screenlock

Class ScreenLockController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.miscservices.screenlock.ScreenLockController

  • public class ScreenLockController
extends Object
    Provides methods to control the screen lock and query the lock status.

    Your application can call the methods to unlock the device screen and check whether the screen is locked or unlocked.

    Since:
    3

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static ScreenLockController getInstance​()
      Obtains the ScreenLockController singleton instance.
      boolean isScreenLocked​()
      Checks whether the screen is currently locked.
      boolean isSecureMode​()
      Checks whether the screen lock of the current device is secure.
      void unlockScreen​(Context abilityContext, UnlockScreenCallback callback)
      Unlocks the screen.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ScreenLockController getInstance​()
        Obtains the ScreenLockController singleton instance.

        Before calling any ScreenLockController method, you must call this method to obtain an instance. Each application process has only one ScreenLockController instance.

        Returns:
        Returns the instance.
        Since:
        3

      • isScreenLocked

        public boolean isScreenLocked​()
        Checks whether the screen is currently locked.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the device screen is locked; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • unlockScreen

        public void unlockScreen​(Context abilityContext,
                         UnlockScreenCallback callback)
        Unlocks the screen.

        If the device screen is currently locked, call this method to unlock the screen.

        Parameters:
        abilityContext - Indicates the application ability context.
        callback - Indicates the callback invoked when the screen is unlocked.
        Since:
        3

      • isSecureMode

        public boolean isSecureMode​()
        Checks whether the screen lock of the current device is secure.

        The secure screen lock means that unlocking the screen requires a password, fingerprint ID, face recognition, or other identification of the user.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the screen lock is secure; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3
